meanings.definition: The quality of being august or dignified.
meanings.sent1: Her augustnesses shone through as she gracefully addressed the crowd.
meanings.sent2: The king's augustnesses was evident in his regal attire and commanding presence.
meanings.sent3: Despite his playful nature, his augustnesses always remained intact.
meanings.sent4: The mountain peak reached such augustnesses that it seemed to touch the sky.
meanings.sent5: The old library exuded an augustnesses that made visitors feel a sense of reverence.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being august or majestic.
meanings.sent1: The augustnesses of the ancient castle left visitors in awe of its grandeur.
meanings.sent2: In the presence of the queen, one could feel the augustnesses of her royal lineage.
meanings.sent3: The little puppy tried to mimic the augustnesses of the lion but ended up looking adorable instead.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set behind the mountains, the sky took on an augustnesses that painted the world in hues of gold.
meanings.sent5: The orchestra's performance captured the augustnesses of the composer's masterpiece.
